```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
require(mlr3learners) 
require(kknn)  
require(class)
require(ggplot2)
library(mlr3)
library(mlr3viz)
library(ggplot2)
library(data.table)
library(sqldf)
library(ggplot2)

```

```{r}
# read in data
setwd("~/Desktop/GRIT/Kibera")

# Step 1: Read the raw data *without* header
dataClean <- fread("kibera_values_cleaned.csv", header = TRUE)

```



```{r}
#summary(dataClean)
```

```{r}

ggplot(dataClean, aes(x = `2.1`)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1, fill = "steelblue", color = "white") +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Age", x = "2.1", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()


```



```{r}
# Assume gender is stored in column '2.2'
dataClean$`2.2` <- factor(dataClean$`2.2`, 
                          levels = c("1", "2"), 
                          labels = c("Female", "Male"))



class(dataClean$'2.2')
ggplot(dataClean, aes(x = `2.1`, fill = `2.2`)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1, color = "white", position = "dodge", alpha = 0.6) +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Age by Gender", x = "Age", y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()

```
